content.description: Climb the obvious, thin, varnished corner. There is a bomber 2 bolt anchor, with rings, at the top.
content.protection: Double tiny cams up to yellow Alien size and 1 each of red Alien to #1 Camalot.
content.location: This route is located at the mouth of Mee Canyon. It is on the buttress on the left side of the canyon, the same buttress with Forward Lookout Tower. Walking along the base of the buttress, you can not miss it.

climbs.name: Nerve Endings
climbs.fa: Josh Thompson and a crew of folks, 3-9-2012

content.description: Start in the the obvious corner. Follow the corner up about 10 feet, then step right on a sloping ledge. Follow the broken crack systems up around slightly right to the base of the obvious, varnished, perfect, splitter crack. Climb the crack until it jogs left, and find the bomber 2 bolt anchor. The anchor has rap rings.
content.protection: 1 yellow Alien and doubles from red Alien through #4 Camalot.
content.location: Hike up Mee Canyon from the river. Nerve Endings is located on the second buttress on the left hand side of the canyon, the first buttress being the one with Forward Lookout Tower. The route is west/southwest-facing and is an extremely obvious, splitter crack through a varnished headwall. The approach takes about 10 minutes.

content.description:
P1. Climb a crux boulder problem right off the deck on sandy sloper jugs. Climb some balancy moves to gain better holds up higher, and finish on the thin crack, 5.12-, 50 feet.

P2. This is an unclimbed obvious crack extension. The crack is really dirty, especially right off the P1 anchors. It is probably in the 5.12 range, 50 feet.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a few micro and finger-sized cams to 0.75 for the top.
content.location:
Left of

Drinking with Gambino

about 100 feet and just to the right of the short wide pillar at the end of the buttress, this climbs a short, varnished face with a 2 bolt anchor below an obvious, right-arching, steep crack.

climbs.name: Moon River
climbs.fa: Josh Thompson and Andrew Gram, April 2011

content.description:
Pitch #1. Start up towards a short, wide slot at the base of the obvious corner system overhead. Pull some tough liebackish moves to get yourself into the slot. Continue climbing the corner system above. When you reach a white bulge, find a bolt, and move around to the right. Climb past 2 fixed pitons. Then head right across a short slab section to gain the anchor at the base of another corner system. This pitch will go clean and maybe free, 5.11 A2-, 140 feet.

Pitch #2. Climb up the obvious corner above. Start with a few free moves to gain the varnished corner. Pass 1 fixed piton. When the varnish ends, move around the bulge to the left. A few more moves gets you into a short chimney section. Climb up and onto the HUGE ledge on the right. This pitch will go clean easily but free is doubtful, 5.8 A2-, 100 feet.

Pitch #3. Climb up the final summit spire. There are multiple bolts to lead the way, 5.9 A1. 60 feet.

Rappel the route to descend. All the anchors are bomber.
content.protection:
Nuts 1.5 sets, no brass.

Cams: 2-3 each - black and blue Aliens; 4-5 - green Aliens;3-4 each - yellow Alien to #2 Camalot; 2 each - #3-#5 Camalot; 1 #6 Camalot.
content.location:
The route is located on the Forward Lookout Tower. This tower looks over the mouth of Mee Canyon, from its lefthand side (looking up canyon). It is easily visible from the river and is a 5-10 minute walk from camp.

The tower was first climbed via a different route by Dougald Macdonald, Randy Day, and Dave Goldstein. ENJOY!

content.description: Climb the right-facing corner of a short pillar ranging from fists to chickenwings. Surmount the first ledge, and either continue up the crack to a bolted anchor at the second ledge or lower off of a bolted anchor at the first ledge. The second pitch is fingers to knee locks (#5s).
content.protection: A single rack 0.4 - 3, five or so #4s, and one or two #5s.
content.location:
Start in the right-facing corner of the short pillar on the far left side of the prominent wall seen from the Mee campsites. If facing Mee Canyon from the river, this wall is on the left side of the mouth of the canyon where the routes

Moondance

,

Drinking with Gambino

, and

Moon River

are located.

climbs.name: Ferry Angle
climbs.fa: Mike Robinson, Benji Perry, James Stover, Chris Terry

content.description: I really enjoyed this route. Climb moderate chimney moves up to the offwidth finish. Plenty of cheats and just 2 actual OW moves make this a pleasant climb. Climb on the outside or inside of the chockstone, stand on top and lower from the slung chockstone.
content.location:
This is the wide crack visible from afar that is just right of

Moondance

.

content.description:
This is another very obvious route on the same buttress as

Moon River

and

Shaking the Goat

.

Pitch #1. Climb the varnished, thin hands corner. It is fairly sustained and very good. Step left at a stance on a white scoop, and belay at 2 good bolts with rings, 80-85 feet, 5.10.

Pitch #2. Continue up the varnished corner. The crack gets a bit wider with more pure hands before getting wider at the top with a short section of chimney. Belay at a small ledge, with 2 good bolts (chains) out to the right, 95-100 feet, 5.10.

The route likely continues to at least the shoulder of the Buttress and possibly the summit.
content.location: Drinking with Gambino is located on the Buttress directly above the Mee Canyon campsite.
